# Create User

Creates a new user in the e-commerce API.

- Method: POST
    
- URL: `http://{{base-url}}/users`
    
- Auth: Bearer token (uses `{{auth-token}}`)
    

## Required Headers

- `Content-Type: application/json`
    
- `Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}`
    

## Path & Query Params

- None
    

## Request Body

JSON object with the following fields:

``` json
{
  "name": "string",
  "email": "string (valid email)",
  "role": "string (e.g., USER | PREMIUM_USER | ADMIN)"
}

 ```

Example:

``` json
{
  "name": "Faisal",
  "email": "faisalkhan12@gmail.com",
  "role": "USER"
}

 ```

## Responses

- 201 Created — User created successfully
    
    - {"success": true, "data": {"id": 9, "name": "Faisal", "email": "[faisalkhan12@gmail.com](https://mailto:faisalkhan12@gmail.com)", "role": "USER"}}
        
- 400 Bad Request — Validation failed (missing/invalid fields)
    
- 401 Unauthorized — Missing or invalid bearer token
    
- 409 Conflict — Email already exists
    
- 500 Internal Server Error — Unexpected error
    

## Variables

- `{{base-url}}` — Base URL of the API (set in the active environment: ecommerce-app)
    
- `{{auth-token}}` — Bearer token for authentication
    

## Notes

- Ensure the active environment has `base-url` and `auth-token` defined.
    
- Roles may be constrained by the server. If unspecified by the backend, default is typically `USER`.
    
- Add tests later to assert status code and response schema.

# Update User

Update an existing user by ID.

## URL

`PUT http://{{base-url}}/users/:id`

- Example with variables resolved: `http://{{base-url}}/users/1`
    

## Method

PUT

## Path Parameters

- `id` (integer, required): The unique identifier of the user to update.
    

## Headers

- `Content-Type: application/json`
    
- `Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}` (if the API requires bearer auth)
    

## Authentication

- Uses a bearer token supplied via the `Authorization` header.
    
- Token variable: `{{auth-token}}` (defined in the active environment: ecommerce-app).
    

## Request Body

JSON object with the fields to update for the user.

Schema

``` json
{
  "name": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "role": "string"
}

 ```

Example

``` json
{
  "name": "Faisal",
  "email": "faisalkhan15@gmail.com",
  "role": "PREMIUM_USER"
}

 ```

Notes

- Only include fields you wish to update. Server behavior for partial updates may vary; this request uses PUT which typically expects a full resource representation.
    

## Responses

### 200 OK

Successful update. Returns the updated user resource.

Example

``` json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Faisal",
    "email": "faisalkhan15@gmail.com",
    "role": "PREMIUM_USER"
  }
}

 ```

### 400 Bad Request

Validation error. The request body failed validation.

Example

``` json
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Invalid email format"
}

 ```

### 401 Unauthorized

Missing or invalid token.

Example

``` json
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Unauthorized"
}

 ```

### 404 Not Found

User with the provided `id` does not exist.

Example

``` json
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "User not found"
}

 ```

## Variables

- `{{base-url}}`: Base API URL (set in the ecommerce-app environment).
    
- `{{auth-token}}`: Bearer token for authorization.
    

Ensure the ecommerce-app environment is active so these variables resolve at runtime.

# Delete User

Deletes a user by ID. Use this to permanently remove a user resource from the system.

- Method: `DELETE`
    
- URL: `{{base-url}}/users/:id` (example below uses `1`)
    

#### Path variables

- `id` (number, required): The user ID to delete.
    

#### Authentication

Use a valid bearer token.

Header

```
Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}

 ```

#### Expected responses

- {"success": true, "data": "User deleted successfully"}
    
- `404 Not Found` – User does not exist.
    
- `401/403` – Missing or invalid authorization.
    

#### Notes

- This operation is irreversible.
    
- Ensure `{{base-url}}` and `{{auth-token}}` are set in the `ecommerce-app` environment.
    

#### Example

Request: `DELETE {{base-url}}/users/1` with header `Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}`.

# Get User by ID

Purpose: Retrieve a single user resource by its unique identifier.

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `http://{{base-url}}/users/:id`
    
    - Path variable `:id` is the numeric user ID.
        

Authentication

- Type: Bearer Token
    
- Token: `{{auth-token}}`
    

Path Parameters

- id (required, number): The user ID to fetch.
    

Query Parameters

- None
    

Headers

- Content-Type: application/json (for consistency; not strictly required on GET)
    
- Authorization: `Bearer {{auth-token}}`
    

Sample Success Response (200)

``` json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "id": 2,
    "name": "Premium User",
    "email": "remium@example.com",
    "role": "PREMIUM_USER"
  }
}

 ```

Possible Error Responses

- 401 Unauthorized: Missing/invalid token. Ensure `{{auth-token}}` is set and valid.
    
- 404 Not Found: No user exists for the provided `id`.
    

Testing Notes

- No tests are defined yet for this request. Consider adding assertions for:
    
    - HTTP status is 200
        
    - Response has `success: true`
        
    - `data` contains expected keys (id, name, email, role) and types.

# Get All Users

Retrieve a paginated list of users with optional sorting.

## Endpoint

- Method: `GET`
    
- URL: `http://{{base-url}}/users`
    
- Full sample with variables and defaults: `http://{{base-url}}/users?page=0&size=10&sort_by=id&direction=ASC`
    

## Authentication

- Type: Bearer Token
    
- Token variable: `{{auth-token}}` (from the active environment: ecommerce-app)
    

## Query Parameters

- `page` (integer, optional, default: `0`) — Zero-based page index to retrieve.
    
- `size` (integer, optional, default: `10`) — Number of records per page.
    
- `sort_by` (string, optional, default: `id`) — Field name to sort by (e.g., `id`, `name`, `createdAt`).
    
- `direction` (string, optional, default: `ASC`) — Sort direction. Allowed values: `ASC`, `DESC`.
    

## Sample Responses

### 200 OK — Success

``` json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "content": [
      {"id": 1, "name": "Faisal", "email": "faisalkhan15@gmail.com", "role": "PREMIUM_USER"},
      {"id": 2, "name": "Premium User", "email": "remium@example.com", "role": "PREMIUM_USER"},
      {"id": 3, "name": "Premium User", "email": "premium@example.com", "role": "PREMIUM_USER"},
      {"id": 4, "name": "User 1", "email": "user1@example.com", "role": "USER"},
      {"id": 5, "name": "User 2", "email": "user2@example.com", "role": "USER"},
      {"id": 6, "name": "User 2", "email": "user3@example.com", "role": "USER"},
      {"id": 7, "name": "Premium User 1", "email": "premium1@example.com", "role": "PREMIUM_USER"},
      {"id": 8, "name": "Premium User 2", "email": "premium2@example.com", "role": "PREMIUM_USER"},
      {"id": 9, "name": "Faisal", "email": "faisalkhan12@gmail.com", "role": "USER"}
    ],
    "pageable": {"pageNumber": 0, "pageSize": 10, "sort": {"sorted": true, "empty": false, "unsorted": false}, "offset": 0, "paged": true, "unpaged": false},
    "last": true,
    "totalPages": 1,
    "totalElements": 9,
    "first": true,
    "size": 10,
    "number": 0,
    "sort": {"sorted": true, "empty": false, "unsorted": false},
    "numberOfElements": 9,
    "empty": false
  }
}

 ```

### 200 OK — Empty Page

``` json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "content": [],
    "pageable": {"pageNumber": 2, "pageSize": 10, "sort": {"sorted": true, "empty": false, "unsorted": false}, "offset": 20, "paged": true, "unpaged": false},
    "last": true,
    "totalPages": 2,
    "totalElements": 20,
    "first": false,
    "size": 10,
    "number": 2,
    "sort": {"sorted": true, "empty": false, "unsorted": false},
    "numberOfElements": 0,
    "empty": true
  }
}

 ```

### 401 Unauthorized

``` json
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Unauthorized"
}

 ```

### 500 Internal Server Error

``` json
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Internal server error"
}

 ```

## Notes on Pagination & Sorting

- Pagination follows a zero-based index: the first page is `page=0`.
    
- Use `size` to control page length. Typical values: 10, 20, 50, 100.
    
- Use `sort_by` in combination with `direction` to order results. Multiple sort fields may or may not be supported depending on backend implementation.
    
- When `content` is empty, check `totalElements` and `totalPages` to decide whether to continue paginating.
    

## Variables

- `{{base-url}}` — Base URL of the API.
    
- `{{auth-token}}` — Bearer token used for authorization.

# Purpose

Create a new product in the catalog.

## Method & URL

- POST http://{{base-url}}/products
    

## Authentication

- Bearer Token using environment variable: `{{auth-token}}`
    

## Request Headers

- Content-Type: application/json
    
- Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}
    

## Request Body

Schema (example fields):

```
{
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "price": number,
  "quantity": number
}

 ```

Example:

```
{
  "name": "Phone",
  "description": "Mobile Phone by Apple",
  "price": 100,
  "quantity": 20000
}

 ```

## Success Response (200)

```
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "id": 4,
    "name": "Phone",
    "description": "Mobile Phone by Apple",
    "price": 100,
    "quantity": 20000
  }
}

 ```

## Error Responses

- {"success": false,"error": "Validation failed"}
    
- {"success": false,"error": "Unauthorized"}
    

## Notes

- Uses environment variables:
    
    - `base-url` for the API host
        
    - `auth-token` for the bearer token
        
- Do not modify URL or body here; update environment variables instead.

# Update Product

Updates an existing product by ID.

- Method: PUT
    
- URL: `http://{{base-url}}/products/:id`
    
- Auth: Bearer token via `{{auth-token}}` (set in the active environment)
    

### Path parameters

- `id` (integer, required): Unique product identifier. Example: `2`.
    

### Request headers

- `Content-Type: application/json`
    
- `Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}`
    

### Request body

JSON object containing fields to update. All fields optional unless enforced by server.

Schema (informal):

``` json
{
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "price": 0,
  "quantity": 0
}

 ```

Example:

``` json
{"name":"Phone","description":"Mobile Phone by Apple","price":300,"quantity":4000}

 ```

### Success response

- Status: `200 OK`
    
- {"success": true,"data": { "id": 2, "name": "Phone", "description": "Mobile Phone by Apple", "price": 300, "quantity": 4000}}
    

### Error responses

- `400 Bad Request`: Invalid payload.
    
- `401 Unauthorized`: Missing/invalid token. Ensure `{{auth-token}}` is set.
    
- `404 Not Found`: Product does not exist.
    
- `500 Internal Server Error`: Unexpected server error.
    

### Notes

- Uses environment variables: `{{base-url}}`, `{{auth-token}}`.
    
- This request resides in the ecommerce-api collection and can be used in automated tests or monitors.

# Delete Product

Deletes a product by its ID. This endpoint is used to permanently remove a product from the catalog.

### URL

```
DELETE {{base-url}}/products/:id

 ```

- Path variables:
    
    - `id` (required): The numeric identifier of the product to delete.
        

### Authorization

- Uses bearer token via environment variable. Ensure your environment defines `{{auth-token}}` and that the request's Authorization header or helper references it.
    

### Headers

- `Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}`
    
- `Content-Type: application/json` (not required for this DELETE with empty body)
    

### Responses

- `200 OK` – Product was deleted successfully.
    
    - {"success": true, "data": "Product deleted successfully"}
        
- `404 Not Found` – No product exists with the given ID.
    
    - {"success": false, "error": "Product not found"}
        
- `401 Unauthorized` – Missing or invalid token.
    
- `500 Internal Server Error` – Server-side error.
    

### Notes

- Ensure `{{base-url}}` points to the correct environment (e.g., staging or production).
    
- This request intentionally has no body.
    

### Example

```
DELETE {{base-url}}/products/1
Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}

 ```

# Get Product by ID

Retrieve a single product resource by its numeric ID.

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{base-url}}/products/:id`
    
- Path params:
    
    - `id` (number, required) — The product identifier.
        
- Auth: Bearer token via `{{auth-token}}` variable (set in environment)
    
- Headers:
    
    - `Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}`
        
    - `Accept: application/json`
        

Variables

- `{{base-url}}` — Base URL of the ecommerce API (e.g., [https://api.example.com](https://api.example.com))
    
- `{{auth-token}}` — Access token for authenticated requests
    

Success Response (200)

```
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "id": 2,
    "name": "Android Phone",
    "description": "Mobile Phone by Android",
    "price": 100,
    "quantity": 19988
  }
}

 ```

Error Responses

- 401 Unauthorized — Missing/invalid token
    
- 404 Not Found — Product with the specified ID does not exist
    

Notes

- Ensure the `{{base-url}}` and `{{auth-token}}` environment variables are set before sending the request.
    
- This request currently targets product ID 2 at `http://{{base-url}}/products/2`.
    

Example cURL

``` bash
curl -X GET "http://{{base-url}}/products/2" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}" \
  -H "Accept: application/json"

 ```

Minimum price value to filter results.
Maximum price value to filter results.
Filter by availability status. true returns only available items, false returns unavailable items.
Page number to retrieve (0-based index). Example: page=0 returns the first page.

Field name by which the results should be sorted. Example: createdAt, name, price.
Sorting direction. Allowed values: ASC or DESC. Default is ASC.

# Login

Authenticate a user and retrieve a bearer token for subsequent requests.

- Method: POST
    
- URL: `http://{{base-url}}/auth/login`
    
- Auth: None for this endpoint. It returns a token used as Bearer auth in other endpoints.
    
- Variables:
    
    - `{{base-url}}` – Base API URL for the current environment.
        

#### Request Body (JSON)

```
{
  "email": "string",
  "password": "string"
}

 ```

Common values in this workspace:

- email: `admin@example.com`, `premium@example.com`
    
- password: `abcd1234`
    

#### Successful Response (200)

```
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "token": "<JWT>",
    "token_type": "Bearer"
  }
}

 ```

#### Post-response behavior

This request's test script extracts `data.token` and saves it to the active environment as `auth-token`.

#### Usage notes

- After a successful login, reference the token in other requests using the Authorization header: `Bearer {{auth-token}}`.
    
- Make sure the active environment defines `base-url`.
    

#### Example curl

```
curl -X POST "http://{{base-url}}/auth/login" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email":"admin@example.com","password":"abcd1234"}'

 ```
